It's worth seeing your primary care doctor as well as the urologists.  Many with Peyronie's have high blood pressure or diabetes as associated diseases.Options to talk to the urologist about:- verapamil injected or verapamil topical with dexamethasone and iontophoresis- low dose radiotherapy- extracorporeal shock wave therapy- Indications for surgery include penile shortening, persistent pain, severe curvature, and penile narrowing or indentation. Various surgical procedures may be utilized with or without use of an inflatable penile prosthesis
